Pediatricians try to work as a team with parents to provide the best possible care for each child. Specifically relating to measles, the article mentions that vaccination works with the body to help it build immunity against the disease in the safest possible way. Over 95% of people receiving the first dose of the measles shot become immune to the disease. That high of a number minimized any possible negative side effects caused by the vaccine. Measles is one of the many diseases known to be eliminated from the United States solely because of nearly universal vaccination. The article highlights that vaccination is one of the safest and most effective ways to prevent disease.
